text:
*Doctoral student for Biomedical Engineering, 4-year position 2019-2022 in Infotech and Faculty of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering, University of Oulu*
<https://rekry.saima.fi/certiahome/open_job_view.html?did=5600&jc=1&id=00006460&lang=en>

Applications are invited for a full-time doctoral student position for a maximum of four years, starting at the earliest on 1.1.2019 in an Infotech research project headed by Adj. Prof. Jukka Kortelainen in the Center for Machine Vision and Signal Analysis, Faculty of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering.

Our work aims to analysis of biomedical signals and other data during intensive care and anesthesia to provide diagnostic information and help in treatment-related decision making.

The position is supervised by Adj. Prof. Jukka Kortelainen and Prof. Guoying Zhao and is focused on creating a next-generation framework for multimodal assessment of pain. The goal is to create a technology that would objectively and reliably be capable of measuring pain experience of intensive care patients. The technology would utilize both biomedical signals, such as EEG and ECG, and video-based expression analysis. This multidisciplinary project has potential for high impact not only in the scientific field, but also in improving the clinical patient care in the intensive care unit.

_Requirements for a doctoral student_

- Master’s degree or an equivalent degree (e.g. licentiate) preferably in Biomedical Engineering or Computer Science. Degree must have been completed with good grades by 31.12.2018 (or latest before the job contract starts);
- Ability to pursue independent research;
- Excellent writing and fluency in English is expected.

_Salary_

The salary of the selected doctoral student will be set on levels 2 – 4 of the national salary scale for the teaching and research staff of Finnish universities. In addition, a supplementary remuneration will be given for personal achievement and performance (max. 50%). The total salary for these levels (before tax) currently ranges from about 1985 to 3621 Euros/month for full-time employment.

_Application_

Applications must be submitted using the electronic application form by 7.12.2018, 23.59 (Finnish local time), with the following attachments as three separate pdf files:
- Complete CV containing contact information of at least two referees (Max. size limit of the attachment: 5 Mbytes)
- Motivation letter (maximum 1 page) describing prior knowledge and research interests and career plans (1-2 pages; max. size limit of the attachment: 2 Mbytes).
- Certificates/Diplomas: Scanned electronic copies of diplomas and transcripts of the records of relevant previous degrees. If the original documents are not in English, Finnish or Swedish, each document must be accompanied by an official certified translation into English or Finnish. (Max. size limit of the attachment: 2 Mbytes)
- Other relevant information

The eligible applicants fitting best in the research profile expected for the position may be invited to an on-site or remote interview. All applicants will be notified when the selection process is completed.

_Contact_

- Adj. Prof. Jukka Kortelainen, e-mail: <mailto:jukka.kortelainen@oulu.fi|jukka.kortelainen@oulu.fi>
- Concerning the general requirements and application procedures: Coordinator Mirjami Jutila, e-mail: <mailto:mirjami.jutila@oulu.fi|mirjami.jutila@oulu.fi>
Очень перспективная технология. В концлагерях и российских тюрьмах испальзовать самое то.
А как с ними сколаборировать можно? Мне нужно пару экспериментов проверить в похожей сфере с помощью ЭЭГ
